description:
This pull request refactors the octree visitor code to use objects and memory
views.  It needs:

 * Review
 * Comparison of speed versus old
 * Extra-special octree checks (tests should pick it up)

I've run the geometry tests, and they work great, but I'm going to run it
through a suite of octree and particle code tests in the next few days.

Ultimately, if this does not incur too much performance overhead, I would like
to refactor the grid visitors the same way, and then finish by unifying the two
sets of code.

I think overall, though, this is way more readable than the void pointer
casting nonsensery that I'd implemented before.
title: Octree visitor refactoring

content.raw: I've tested this on my machine, and answer tests now pass.  I think that it is ready to go, but I would appreciate a review of the source, and if anyone wants to, a check over some of the plots from SPH data.  It would be really good to get this in sooner rather than later, as once this goes in we can start in earnest finishing up some of the octree refactoring and code cleanup efforts.  (Also, then we can merge it with the grid visitors code.)
content.html: I've tested this on my machine, and answer tests now pass. I think that it is ready to go, but I would appreciate a review of the source, and if anyone wants to, a check over some of the plots from SPH data. It would be really good to get this in sooner rather than later, as once this goes in we can start in earnest finishing up some of the octree refactoring and code cleanup efforts. (Also, then we can merge it with the grid visitors code.)

content.raw:
This is a very nice cleanup - in particular making each of the visitor objects its own cdef class makes it easier to follow. I'll admit I don't follow the details about how the visitor system works so I'm not able to closely review the details here.

Thank you for your work on cleaning up the cython code lately!
content.html:
This is a very nice cleanup - in particular making each of the visitor objects its own cdef class makes it easier to follow. I'll admit I don't follow the details about how the visitor system works so I'm not able to closely review the details here.

Thank you for your work on cleaning up the cython code lately!
